intro: Asclepias campestris var. flava, commonly known as the yellow milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the eastern and central United States. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers and milky sap. The plant typically grows in open fields and along roadsides, thriving in full sun. Its leaves are opposite, heart-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. The flowers are clustered in umbels and attract various pollinators, including butterflies and bees.
